summary: 10/06/1993: An incendiary device damaged a Royal Mail sorting machine. A further five devices were found at the sorting office in Ascot Road, Watford, Hertfordshire. Animal rights activists were suspected of carrying out the attack in protest against "blood sports" enthusiasts.
target1: Royal Mail sorting office in Hertfordshire on Ascot road.
motive: Animal rights activists carried out the attack in protest against "blood sports enthusiasts."
propcomment: The device caused damaged a Royal Mail sorting machine.
scite1: Roger Williams and Michael Harvey, “Blood Sports Lovers Warned after Postal Blast,” Press Association, October 6, 1993.
